author: QuesoGr7

text: @lemurdragonsan Not sure what a scale of 8/10 is to you, but that pretty much equals great for me..haha. Voice acting? Do you mean the usual Nintendo type voice acting, as in the mumbley type voicing? Or actual voice acting? And yeah, the game has its gimmicks attached to it, like with a lot of other Wii titles, but I didn't find the gimmicks enough to be distracting from the overall abstract/atmosphere of the game. Pretty much agree with you, though.

Davrial aka Blue Mario

text: @EturnusFrost Honestly, I tried to like it.  I was at a cloud dungeon when I finally just gave up.  If I can't bring myself to beat a game once, then there's a problem.  I guess it just wasn't for me =P
author: ProjectJ

text: @EturnusFrost It is a great game, but I think it just doesn't deserve to be called a true sequel.
author: Superbird

text:
@EturnusFrost Nah, I was just trying to point out why I was disappointed of the game. ^^
But its good to see that you can play PM1 and 2 a lot and still like SPM.
author: WereDictionary

text: @EturnusFrost Well, yeah to clever levels, good story - okay if you think so. but the design and the way things were made up were just poor. The people were just a bunch of differently arranged squares and rectangles and I really missed atmospheric dungeons and cities. SPM wasnt a bad game per se, it was just horribly bland. ._.
author: WereDictionary

text:
@EturnusFrost people wanted another rpg, since that used to be one of paper mario's trademarks. so while SPM is a good game in its own regard, people look down on it because they were disappointed of the battle system. 
And I feel with them - SPM feels like you are just running through a bunch of levels, the rpg predecessors had so much more to them.
author: WereDictionary

text: @EturnusFrost AHA! somone who agrees with me!

text: I thought Super Paper Mario was alright in it's own right, but it tried to mix RPGs and platformers and just came out with an average hybrid of the two. Looking forward to the return of the RPG-based Paper Mario on the 3DS.
author: Michael Hunt

text:
@EturnusFrost Yes, Superstar Saga is definitely my favorite of the three, Partners in Time being kind of lackluster and unmemorable, and Bowser's Inside Story was great too, the focus being Bowser, which was nice.

I know what you mean with the Paper Mario series. The original is probably my favorite Mario RPG, being the first video game I played on my own.
author: dx619hey

text: This game really has an amazing soundtrack (the same going for most Mario RPGs). Each track, especially the battle tracks feel very elaborate when you listen closely, but are still pretty subtle. Even you don't pay much attention to them, they'll probably stick in your head for a long time afterwards.
author: dx619hey

text:
@SupraDarky OMG, now Paper Mario can leave his 2D limitations, and become 3D!!... oh wait.

But yeah, the 3D could probably make for some easier precise platforming, which would be a plus for Paper Mario. I bet they'd have fun throwing stuff in our face too.
author: dx619hey

text: @EturnusFrost Yes, agreed. But I also noticed no love for the Mario & Luigi games. I hope you've played those too, especially the first one, Superstar Saga.
author: dx619hey
